avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. In shady slopes at high altitudes from around 2600 m, fresh packs of prone-to-triggering drift snow have formed. Small and near-surface avalanches in particular can easily be triggered there in a few places, especially in extremely steep gullies and bowls and behind ridgelines. In these areas, there are still isolated trigger points for small avalanches in the old snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low-volume drift snow and rare avalanche prone locations in old snow

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow cover, snowpack is moist or even wet due to heat and rain up to medium to high altitudes. There are crusts on the surface and inside the snow cover, snowpack. In their vicinity, angular crystals can still be found at shady slopes, which can occasionally serve as a weak layer. The snow depth is well below average at all altitudes.

weatherForecast.comment: Brisk southerly foehn winds in places until Thursday night. Good visibility on the mountains on Friday and hardly any wind or clouds apart from patches of fog in some valleys. Warming to around 4 degrees at 2000 metres, around -4 degrees at 3000 metres, frost line around 2500 metres.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. In shady slopes, fresh drift snow packs can be triggered in places by individuals, avalanches usually remain small. In areas adjacent to the ridgeline, crest or summit, there are isolated trigger points for mainly small avalanches that are difficult to disturb, even in old snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Injury from stones and falling are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow depth is well below average for the time of year, low to medium altitudes and the sunny slopes are widely covered in snow. The snow cover, snowpack will be soaked far up during the daytime changes. In shady slopes, weak layers of angular crystals still remain in the snow cover, snowpack, mostly in the vicinity of crusts.

weatherForecast.comment: Moderate to brisk winds in the foehn corridors until Thursday night. On Friday, good visibility on the mountains and hardly any wind or clouds apart from patches of fog in some valleys. Warming to around 4 degrees at 2000 metres, frost line around 2500 metres.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. There is usually not enough snow for snow sports and avalanches can hardly be triggered.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Lack of snow and stones are the main dangers.

snowpackStructure.comment: There is no closed snow cover, snowpack and the terrain is mostly bare.

weatherForecast.comment: Good visibility on the mountains on Friday and hardly any wind or clouds apart from patches of fog in some valleys. Warming to around 4 degrees at 2000 metres.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Locally, drift snow of low thickness covers dangers due to lack of snow.
